transactionId.title: The transaction ID uniquely identifies this specific buy data extract.
transactionId.description: The transaction ID uniquely identifies the extract and must be returned as part of the allocation instructions.

estimateNumber.title: SpectraOX internal estimate number
estimateNumber.description: The estimate number will be provided in the schedule export schema and must be returned as-is in this property

transactions.title: A list of actions to take on the buy data that represent a series of brand allocation instructions
transactions.description: Every inbound unit from the schedule extract will be included in a single transaction and each transaction in this list describes what (if any) changes are required to construct the desired allocations.

inboundBuyNumbers.title: Buy numbers from inbound schedule data included in this transaction.
inboundBuyNumbers.description: Buy numbers from the inbound schedule data will be changed/replaced with units with all the same attributes as the original buy, with the attributes listed in the outbound units replacing those in the copied units. All units within the array of inboundBuyNumbers must have equivalent values in the following fields or the entire transaction will be rejected: networkCode, daypartCode, programCode, airDays, startTime, airDate, all demographic ratings. Costs must be no greater than one (1) dollar different.

outboundUnits.title: Outbound units describe new units to replace existing inbound units
outboundUnits.description: Outbound units will replace inbound units (logically if not physically) with versions that are identical to their replacements with attributes changed as described within the objects properties in this array. A blank/null array represents an instruction to leave the inbound units completely unchanged. All units with a non-null updateInvalidReason must be returned with a blank/null array to represent no change. Where non-null outbound units exist, all dollars and unit lengths must sum between the sets of inbound and outbound units. Assuming the extract is made with a null updateInvalidReason code... if the outboundUnits count match inboundBuyNumbers, they all will be treated as changed. If the outboundUnits count is more than the inboundBuyNumbers count, the additional ones will be treated as adds. If the outboundUnits count is less than the inboundBuyNumbers count, the ones that are not present will be pre-empted. The outboundUnits will be mapped to the inboundBuyNumbers in the same order, meaning the first outboundUnit will be treated as the buy with the first entry in the inboundBuyNumbers, the second outboundUnit will be treated as the buy with the second entry in the inboundBuyNumbers and so on.

brandCode.title: The brand code for the new unit.
brandCode.description: The brand code for the new unit. This code must exist within the SpectraOX system already. If the buy is left unallocated, the code will be an empty string. Failure to match will result in the rejection of the entire transaction

timeCost.title: The time cost for the new unit.
timeCost.description: The time cost for the new unit must be positive and less than the maximum possible cost in the SpectraOX system. The sum of inboundBuyNumbers existing costs must equal the sum of all time cost fields in the outbound units or the entire transaction will be rejected.

unitLength.title: The unit length of the new unit.
unitLength.description: The unit length of the new unit. The sum of all of the inbound buynumber units must equal the sum of the outbound unit length values or the entire transaction will be rejected.

estDemos.title: The estimated demographic ratings for the new unit.
estDemos.description: The estimated demographic ratings for the new unit

demoType.title: The demographic modifier for this demo from the inbound schedule data.
demoType.description: The demographic modifier distinguishes differences in ethnicity and/or Nielsen ratings products/streams

demoCode.title: The demographic (i.e. sex and age range) estimate for the new unit.
demoCode.description: The demographic code provided by the schedule data will be returned with any needed changes. The sum of all demographics may be different than the sum of total inbound demographics.

estRtgData.title: The numeric rating for the new unit.

estImpData.title: The numeric rating for the new unit.
